item.title: 英伟达™（Nvidia®）首席执行官的影响力不断扩大，超越了技术领域
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，弗拉德-萨沃夫（Vlad Savov）将探讨现代科技首席执行官的外交工作。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Vlad Savov looks at the diplomatic errands that accompany the job of being a modern tech CEO.】

item.title: 挥霍无度的沙特阿拉伯无法再为世界提供资金
item.description: 您好，来自多哈。我是《彭博新经济》编辑部主任埃里克-沙茨克（Erik Schatzker），为您带来今年卡塔尔经济论坛的通讯特刊。请将反馈意见和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：Hello from Doha. I’m Erik Schatzker, editorial director of Bloomberg New Economy, bringing you a special edition of the newsletter from this year’s Qatar Economic Forum. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 印度为美国贸易协议制定分阶段时间表
item.description: 印度商务部长皮尤什-戈亚尔（Piyush Goyal）将于周二结束对华盛顿为期四天的访问，他表示与美国官员就贸易协议进行了 "良好的讨论"。【原文：India’s Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is wrapping up a four-day visit to Washington on Tuesday, and he’s reporting “good discussions” with US officials on a trade deal.】

item.title: 中国在关税影响下突击花钱，预算赤字创历史新高
item.description: 在与美国的贸易冲突升级期间，中国政府加大了对经济的支持力度，财政刺激政策将其四个月的预算赤字推向了历史新高。【原文：China’s fiscal stimulus pushed its four-month budget deficit to a record high, as the government ramped up support for the economy during an escalation in its trade conflict with the US.】

item.title: 美国旨在遏制中国人工智能实力，马来西亚淡化华为交易
item.description: 马来西亚宣布将建立首个由华为技术有限公司芯片驱动的人工智能系统，但一天后又与这一声明撇清了关系，凸显了这个亚洲国家在中美人工智能竞赛中的微妙地位。【原文：Malaysia declared it’ll build a first-of-its-kind AI system powered by Huawei Technologies Co. chips, only to distance itself from that statement a day later, underscoring the Asian nation’s delicate position in the US-Chinese AI race.】

item.title: 卡塔尔基金在认捐 5000 亿美元后，对美国的支出翻了一番
item.description: 在 5000 亿美元投资承诺的支持下，卡塔尔财富基金未来几年对美国的年度支出将翻一番。【原文：Qatar’s wealth fund is set to see its annual outlays into the US double in coming years on the back of a $500 billion investment pledge.】

item.title: 土耳其看到 18 亿美元战争结束带来的 "巨大 "和平红利
item.description: 土耳其表示，库尔德分离主义组织决定停止在该国东南部长达 40 年的战争，土耳其有望从中获得 "巨大的 "经济收益。【原文：Turkey said it expects to reap “huge” economic gains from the Kurdish separatist group’s decision to stop its 40-year war in the country’s southeast.】

item.title: 美国软化关税，花旗认为七国集团会议后美元将走软
item.description: 花旗集团称，在本周的七国集团会议之后，美元可能会进一步下跌，因为作为与美国贸易谈判的一部分，全球领导人将讨论货币政策。【原文：Citigroup Inc. said the dollar could fall further after this week’s Group-of-Seven meeting as global leaders discuss currency policies as part of their trade negotiations with the US.】

item.title: 法官裁定，前摩根大通交易员被不公平地解雇，尽管存在恶搞行为
item.description: 一名前摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：An ex-JPMorgan Chase & Co. commodities trader was unfairly dismissed even after a London judge found that “unusual and suspicious” cocoa trades were likely spoofing.】

item.title: 欧洲央行 "不排除 "6 月再次降息的可能
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员克拉斯-克诺（Klaas Knot）表示，下个月有可能再次降低借贷成本，但他强调，在没有看到新的季度预测之前做出决定还 "为时过早"。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Klaas Knot said another reduction in borrowing costs is possible next month, though stressed that it’s “too early” to make decisions without seeing fresh quarterly forecasts.】

item.title: 尽管价格屡创新高，中国黄金进口量仍飙升至 11 个月新高
item.description: 在贵金属需求增加促使中国央行放宽对金银流入的限制之后，尽管价格创下新高，中国上个月的黄金进口量仍是近一年来最多的。【原文：China imported the most gold in nearly a year last month despite record prices, after heightened demand for the precious metal prompted the central bank to ease restrictions on bullion inflows.】

item.title: 摩根大通大胆预测欧洲股市将跑赢美国股市
item.description:
该银行认为美股今年余下时间将下跌，而欧洲股市将上涨

The bank sees US stocks falling for rest of year while Europe gains

】

item.title: 卡塔尔计划大幅扩大液化天然气实物交易量
item.description: 卡塔尔计划大力发展液化天然气贸易业务，以补充国内不断扩大的超冷燃料生产。【原文：Qatar plans to significantly boost its liquefied natural gas trading business to complement its expanding domestic production of the super-chilled fuel.】

item.title: Alphabet 交易员希望开发者活动带来人工智能叙事转变
item.description: Alphabet 公司的投资者正在关注本周的开发者大会，以了解该公司能否在人们担心其长期以来的市场主导地位摇摇欲坠的情况下，重新树立新的形象。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s investors are looking to this week’s developer conference to see if the company can reset the narrative amid fears that its long-standing market dominance is on shaky ground.】

item.title: 大型科技公司的窘境让股票期权专业人士对前景看法不一
item.description: 周一，美股的逢低买盘是一个关键主题，但期权市场发出的信号表明，在一个关键领域，交易者对未来几个月的前景仍然信心不足：大型科技股。【原文：Dip-buying in US stocks was a key theme Monday, but the options market is signaling that there’s one crucial area where traders remain far from convinced about the outlook for the next few months: Big Tech.】

item.title: 日本大型非寿险公司计划出售交叉持股
item.description: 日本三大伤亡保险公司计划在 4 月开始的财年内出售总计约 1.37 万亿日元（95 亿美元）的交叉持股，以推动根据政府政策减少战略持股。【原文：Japan’s three major casualty insurers plan to sell a total of about ¥1.37 trillion ($9.5 billion) of cross-held shares in the fiscal year started April in a push to reduce strategic holdings in line with government policy.】

item.title: 荷兰国际集团（ING）认为新兴市场货币的套利交易可能会受到推动
item.description: 荷兰国际集团银行（ING Bank NV）表示，新兴市场货币正受益于美元走软，如果美国降息，这些货币可能会受到进一步提振，吸引更多资金进入利差交易。【原文：Emerging-market currencies are benefiting from a weaker dollar and they may get a further boost if the US cuts interest rates, attracting more capital into carry trades, according to ING Bank NV.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦在贸易逆风中下调经济增长预期
item.description: 巴基斯坦政府下调了本财政年度的经济增长预期，原因是全球贸易中断和国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）收紧支出条件对这个南亚国家的经济造成了影响。【原文：Pakistan’s government lowered its economic growth projection for the fiscal year as global trade disruptions and tighter spending conditions by the International Monetary Fund weighed on the South Asian nation’s economy.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚达纳塔拉公司希望通过兼并和关闭对 800 家国有企业进行重大改革
item.description: 印尼主权财富基金 Daya Anagata Nusantara 正在审查 800 多家国有公司和子公司的运营情况，作为可能涉及合并和关闭的全面改革的一部分。【原文：Indonesia’s sovereign wealth fund Daya Anagata Nusantara is reviewing the operations of more than 800 state companies and subsidiaries as part of a sweeping overhaul that would likely involve mergers and closures.】

item.title: 债券市场摆脱美国降级影响，低迷买家竞相转向股市
item.description: 进入周一后，股票交易员们都知道这是一个难看的布局，在穆迪上周末下调美国债务评级后，期货在盘前交易中走低，而国债收益率则急剧走高。【原文：Stock traders knew it was an ugly setup entering Monday, with futures lower in premarket action and Treasury yields racing higher after Moody’s downgraded the US debt at the very end of last week.】

item.title: 汇款征税计划对美国在中美洲的盟友构成威胁
item.description: 共和党提出的对汇款征税的提案将对美国一些最贫穷的邻国造成经济打击，其中包括唐纳德-特朗普总统的亲密盟友。【原文：A Republican proposal to tax remittances would deliver an economic blow to some of the US’s poorest neighbors, including a close ally of President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 期权交易员押注七国集团会议前欧元涨势仍将延续
item.description: 就在七国集团财长和央行行长在加拿大举行会议之际，市场出现了一些乐观的信号，交易员们对欧元的反弹势头越来越有信心。【原文：Traders are growing more confident that the euro’s rally has further to run, with upbeat signals emerging just as Group-of-Seven finance ministers and central bank governors meet in Canada.】

item.title: 新世界要求银行在 6 月前再融资 110 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，新世界发展有限公司已要求银行在 6 月底前为其 875 亿港元（112 亿美元）的贷款进行再融资，因为这家资金短缺的建筑商正寻求迅速充实其流动资金。【原文：New World Development Co. has asked banks to refinance HK$87.5 billion ($11.2 billion) of its loans by the end of June, according to people familiar with the matter, as the cash-strapped builder seeks to quickly shore up its liquidity.】

item.title: 英国央行皮尔警告英国降息过快
item.description: 英国央行首席经济学家休-皮尔（Huw Pill）在解释本月早些时候提出的维持借贷成本不变的请求时表示，他担心英国利率下降得太快。【原文：Bank of England Chief Economist Huw Pill said he is concerned that UK interest rates are coming down too quickly as he explained his plea to keep borrowing costs unchanged earlier this month.】

item.title: 乌干达贸易顾问称，尽管美国遭遇挫折，但出口仍在激增
item.description: 据乌干达总统高级顾问称，尽管这个东非国家在颁布了严厉的反同性恋法后失去了进入美国市场的优惠条件，但该国的出口仍然激增。【原文：Uganda’s exports have surged despite the east African nation losing its preferential access to US markets after it enacted a harsh anti-homosexuality law, according to a top presidential adviser.】

item.title: 闲置工厂无法使用，印度缩减天然气车队
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度已经淘汰了约五千兆瓦的燃气发电能力，这些发电能力在闲置多年后已无法使用。【原文：India has phased out about five gigawatts of gas-fired power capacity that became inoperable after being left idle for years, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国央行行长丁格拉支持降息半点以发表经济声明
item.description: 英国央行利率制定者斯瓦蒂-丁格拉（Swati Dhingra）表示，她希望在本月的会议上与其他政策制定者决裂，投票支持降息半个百分点，从而就英国经济的走向发表 "声明"。【原文：Bank of England rate-setter Swati Dhingra said she wanted to make a “statement” about the direction of the UK economy by breaking with other policymakers and voting for a half-point interest-rate cut at this month’s meeting.】

item.title: F1 管理机构在连续五年亏损后恢复盈利
item.description: 在备受争议的主席穆罕默德-本-苏拉耶姆（Mohammed Ben Sulayem）的主持下，一级方程式赛车管理机构在经历了五年的亏损后已恢复盈利。【原文：Formula One’s governing body has returned to profitability after five years of losses, under the aegis of its controversial president Mohammed Ben Sulayem.】

item.title: 美国下调评级为香港基金投资国债敲响警钟
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，穆迪（Moody's Ratings）下调美债评级后，香港的养老基金经理们正在敲响警钟，他们可能会被迫抛售所持有的国债。【原文：Hong Kong’s pension fund managers are sounding the alarm of potential forced selling on their Treasury holdings after a downgrade by Moody’s Ratings of US debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 欧洲央行认为全球贸易紧张局势升级带来金融稳定风险
item.description: 欧洲中央银行警告说，不断升级的全球关税紧张局势已成为金融稳定和全球经济的 "重大隐患"。【原文：The European Central Bank warned that escalating global tariff tensions have emerged as a “significant concern” for financial stability and the global economy.】
